DOC.HEAD: Supreme Court Lets Name Stand
Eds: ADDS one grafs with Bledsoe families not related.
DOC.TEXT: The state Supreme Court won't intervene in the case of two women at odds over their names, leaving the small community of Salt Rock with two Shirley Bledsoes. The court Tuesday refused 4-1 to hear the case of Shirley Jean Bledsoe, who asked that Shirley Rae Bledsoe be forced to change her name. Shirley Jean Bledsoe contends the name has caused a mixup in mail and telephone calls in the community of 900, situated about 10 miles from Huntington. The dispute began after a judge allowed Shirley Rae Lambert to change her last name to Bledsoe in May. Shirley Rae Bledsoe said she and her two children have used the Bledsoe name because it was her common-law husband's. Shirley Jean Bledsoe argued the judge erred in granting the name change. The two Bledsoe families are not related.
